revised_title: External Sensory Morphology and Hairplate System of Trichogramma Minutum
tldr: This study examines the external sensory morphology of the legs and hairplate system of female Trichogramma minutum, a parasitoid wasp. The research describes all sensilla and associated structures identified by electron microscopy, focusing on the hairplates associated with the antennae and neck region. The study discusses the structure and function of these sensory structures in walking, proprioceptive control of posture, and gravity detection, as well as their role in detecting and measuring host curvature.
